title: Spoil Your Favorite People With These Luxury Valentineâ€™s Day Gifts

Whether youâ€™re shopping for your partner (yes, there are gifts for him, too) or your Galentine bestiesâ€¦ or just want to send this wishlist as a *hint hint, wink wink* to a loved one who struggles with gift-giving, thereâ€™s a ton of spoil-worthy items ahead.

From under-$50 bath robes to $600 red-light showerheads, you'll find a range of luxury Valentineâ€™s Day gifts, no matter the budget. One thingâ€™s for sure: these picks will make your special someone feel truly spoiled and loved come February 14.

title: Neptune In Aries Begins Itâ€™s 14-Year Transit â€” & Youâ€™ll Experience Great Change
text:
Neptune In Aries Begins Itâ€™s 14-Year Transit â€” & Youâ€™ll Experience Great Change

Elusive and empathetic Neptune is re-entering Aries on January 26th, offering us a second chance to understand the journey ahead. This time around,Â weâ€™llÂ go full throttle in Aries to find our path until March 2039. TheÂ nearlyÂ 14-yearÂ transit is augmenting the world and our lives.Â 

To understand how transit affects us,Â itâ€™sÂ essential to look to the past to gain a clearer perspective. When Neptune was previously in Aries,Â weâ€™veÂ seen reformation, uprisings, and advancements in society, particularly in the medical and scientific fields. Empires have risen, and others have fallen in history when Neptune has been in Aries.Â To sum it up, the good comes with its challenges â€” that is how Neptune rolls.Â Â 

Last year,Â NeptuneÂ made a quick entrance into Aries from March 30thÂ to October 22nd, then moonwalked back into Pisces. Â In questionable times, people have sometimes turned to mysticism to give them a sense of control and order amidst the political chaos. Spiritual Neptune urges us toÂ take action to changeÂ our lives by any means possible. We can expect more magic until 2039.Â 

One of the most important astrological transits of the year occurs on February 20th, when Neptune and Saturn link up in Aries. This planetary connection is set to bring sweeping changes to the collective, ushering in a new state of mind. A new era of creativity, innovation, and societal transformation is unfolding. The 1989 Neptune and Saturn conjunction in Sagittarius coincided with the fall of the Berlin Wall and the onset of the Velvet Revolution.Â Although the alignment of these two celestial entities occursÂ approximately everyÂ 36 years, it has been centuries since they last came together in Aries. The once-in-a-lifetime alignment of Neptune and Saturn in Aries is making our dreams a reality, as long as we approach our progress with pragmatism and remain committed to the cause.Â Â 

Take note: July is going to be aÂ stellarÂ month for Neptune in Aries! Neptune and Uranus in Gemini harmonize on July 15th,Â changingÂ the way we communicate with others. Neptune and Jupiter in Leo gently touch each other on July 20th, enhancing our compassion and artistry. Neptune and Pluto in Aquarius spark each other up on July 25th, rebirthing our ideology with novel perspectives.Â Weâ€™llÂ use our voice to fight authoritative forces and trust our intuition to guide us through challenging situations and choices.Â Â 

The following 13 years are going to intensify the effects of Neptune in Aries. But 2026 is going to bring us into a higher state of consciousness. We have until 2039 to figure out our next steps. For now, we must prioritize ourselves. We hold the ultimate power over our own success.Â Donâ€™tÂ forget that!Â

title: 17 Perfect Valentineâ€™s Day Manicures, From Cat Eye To Polka Dots
text:
17 Perfect Valentineâ€™s Day Manicures, From Cat Eye To Polka Dots

As far as classic accents go, tiny red or pink hearts make for a fun manicure any time of year, not just the first week of February. But seeing as weâ€™re heading into Valentineâ€™s Day season, we have a few ideas to level it up.

Our favorite manicures of the moment are loosely inspired by Cupid, flowers, and all things love. But just like the poppy-red Sezane cardigan in your wardrobe, these nail looks are timeless and a little flirty.Â 

From a glossy black manicure with heart details to kitschy coquette nails, weâ€™ve compiled the coolest Valentineâ€™s Day nail art ahead.

DashDividers_1_500x100

title: The Ordinaryâ€™s New Milky Moisturizer Is For Everyone, But My Dry Skin Loves It Most
text:
The Ordinaryâ€™s New Milky Moisturizer Is For Everyone, But My Dry Skin Loves It Most

HavingÂ combination skinÂ is like bringing all yourÂ different friendship groupsÂ togetherÂ onÂ your birthday â€” but instead of enjoying yourself on the karaoke machine,Â youâ€™reÂ making sure they get along. Keeping every personality happy at once is no easy feat, and the same goes forÂ managingÂ twoÂ skin types. In my experience,Â moisturizers for dry skinÂ tend to be unctuously thick, which can trigger breakouts, while those made forÂ oily skinÂ are often too light to make a difference.Â SoÂ when I find a product that does it all â€” quenching dry patches and delivering hydration without a greasy feel â€” IÂ have toÂ shout about it. Enter:Â The Ordinaryâ€™s new Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ Microemulsion.Â 

What is The Ordinaryâ€™s Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ Microemulsion, and what are the benefits?Â 

Donâ€™tÂ be fooled by Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ Microemulsion.Â At first glance, itÂ looks like one of theÂ brandâ€™sÂ many serums, and while itÂ boasts a lightweight, milky consistency and comes in a dropper bottle, this product isÂ actually aÂ moisturizer.Â 

The Ordinary drew inspirationÂ from K-beauty, specifically milky skincare textures, when developing this moisturizer, and its star ingredient â€” rice lipids â€” alsoÂ nodsÂ to Eastern beauty rituals. You might be familiar with rice water in skincare, butÂ lipidsÂ areÂ a little different. NYC-based dermatologistÂ Joshua Zeichner, MD, explains, â€œRice lipids are natural fats derived from the outer layer of the rice grain known as the bran, and theyÂ have emollient benefits.â€ This, adds Dr. Zeichner,Â meansÂ theyÂ â€œfill in cracksâ€Â between cells on the surface of the skin. As a result, Dr. Zeichner explains that rice lipids canÂ soften the outer skin layer,Â or what is known as the skin barrier. Â 

The Ordinaryâ€™s Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ Microemulsion, $13

Thereâ€™sÂ alsoÂ ectoin, a skincare ingredientÂ thatâ€™sÂ finally getting its dues in skincare.Â â€œEctoinÂ isÂ a naturallyÂ derived compound that helps maintain a healthy skin barrier and protects skin from the environment,â€ says Dr. Zeichner. He adds thatÂ itâ€™sÂ naturally found in bacteria that live in extreme conditions, helping those bacteriaÂ to survive. â€œIn skincare, it improves hydration and provides antioxidant benefits to prevent inflammation,â€ continues Dr. Zeichner.Â If your skin feels rough, flaky, or tight after cleansing, thenÂ ectoinÂ is for you. Even better? It has a soothing effect on inflamed skin,Â and over time, it can help improve uneven skin texture.Â Â 

For the ingredient buffs, hydrating electrolyteÂ moleculesÂ and amino acids â€” the building blocks of skin-strengthening proteins â€” are also present in this milky moisturizer. These are both present in the skin anyway, but sometimes our reserves run low, resulting in dry skin. But thereâ€™s good news: â€œThese ingredients have been replicated and used in skincare products,â€Â says Dr. Zeichner, â€œand they pull hydration into the skin.â€ As someone currently usingÂ high-strength retinolÂ and really feeling the effects ofÂ cold weatherÂ and central heating, this sounded right up my alley.Â 

What makes The Ordinaryâ€™s Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ Microemulsion special?Â 

Lightweight moisturizers can be hit orÂ miss. In fact, my bathroom cabinet is lined with gel-cream products that keep my oily T-zone happy but justÂ donâ€™tÂ cut it on my dry patches, so IÂ slottedÂ this into my routineÂ the day it landed at my doorÂ â€” andÂ Iâ€™mÂ soÂ gladÂ I did.Â Â 

I started using it after ditching aÂ high-strength acidÂ that wreckedÂ my skinÂ barrier, and within just a couple of days, my skin had already recovered. It was less red andÂ angry;Â the dry skin around my mouth had disappeared, and there was a subtle dewy sheen that meant IÂ didnâ€™tÂ want to wear as much foundation. I ended up dropping my thicker moisturizer and shelving my hydrating serum, too, because this does it all. I even take it up to my eyes and use it as an eye cream â€”Â itâ€™s thatÂ moisturizing.Â 

Besides the powerhouse ingredients, how the moisturizer is made is pretty special.Â Without boring you with the science, the formula goes throughÂ microfluidization,Â a high-pressure mixing technique that blends light, water-based ingredients with slightly heavier, oil-based ones. The result? A lightweight, comfortable moisturizer that absorbs quickly but isÂ substantialÂ enough to hydrate evenÂ dryÂ skin.Â 

What to know about The Ordinaryâ€™s Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ MicroemulsionÂ 

â€¢ Reduces visible skin redness after one use.Â 

â€¢ Provides hydration for up to 24 hours and repairs a weakened skin barrier.Â 

â€¢ Can be used in the morning andÂ evening and comes inÂ 60mlÂ andÂ 120mlÂ bottles.Â 

How do you use The Ordinaryâ€™s Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ Microemulsion, and is it worth it?Â 

My skincare routine is pretty simple.Â In the morning, I wash my face with a cream cleanser, apply a pipette-full of Rice Lipids +Â Ectoin, then finish with three finger lengths of sunscreen. In the evening, I double cleanse to remove all traces of makeup and sunscreen, apply Rice Lipids +Â Ectoin, and finish with my retinal serum. I find that, even though this moisturizer is featherlight, it provides a nice cushion for retinoids and helps reduce irritation and flaky patches of skin.Â 

BecauseÂ itâ€™sÂ such an all-rounder,Â Iâ€™veÂ happily and easily recommended it to anyone looking for a simple moisturizer that transcends seasons. WhileÂ itâ€™sÂ working wonders on my skin this winter,Â itâ€™llÂ be just as brilliantÂ comeÂ spring and summer, thanks to its quenching feel and lack of any slippery residue. Better still, aÂ 60mlÂ bottle is only $13. If you love it as much as me, youÂ grabÂ theÂ 120mlÂ bottle, which is $22.50.Â Â 

Where can you get The Ordinaryâ€™s Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ Microemulsion?Â 

You can buy The Ordinaryâ€™s Rice Lipids +Â EctoinÂ MicroemulsionÂ onÂ The Ordinaryâ€™s websiteÂ now.Â

title: The Very Best Beauty Products Worth Your Money In 2026
The Best Moisturizers To Quench Thirsty Dry Skin
text:
The Best Moisturizers To Quench Thirsty Dry Skin It may not be as trendy as the latest PDRN serum or sleek gadget, but if there's one skincare step that's giving workhorse vibes, it's definitely moisturizer. From shielding skin from dry, cold weather to strengthening the skin barrier, proper hydration and moisture (which are two different things, both important: In layman's terms, hydration is more surface-level, lending an immediate softening, plumping effect to skin, while moisturizing locks in hydration via oils/butters to prevent evaporation.) is an essential step in your routine, and one worth investing in.

I personally learned (the hard way, might I add) that neglecting moisturizer is honestly, one of the worst things you can do to your skin. As an acne-prone gal, I spent more years than I'd care to admit robbing my face of hydration in the hopes it would curb my breakouts, when in reality, it only exacerbated them since my sebum production skyrocketed as a result of dehydration.

As beauty editors, we test hundreds of moisturizers a year, and as such, know a thing or two about the ones that actually work and the ones worth skipping. Ahead, the 12 best moisturizers for dry skin that really quenched our thirst.

At Refinery29, weâ€™re here to help you navigate this overwhelming world of stuff. All of our market picks are independently selected and curated by the editorial team. If you buy something we link to on our site, Refinery29 may earn commission.

title: Every Dermatologist I Know Swears By La Roche-Posay, Namely These 8 Products
text:
Every Dermatologist I Know Swears By La Roche-Posay, Namely These 8 Products

Iâ€™m very lucky to have access to some of the worldâ€™s top dermatologists and skincare professionals thanks to my line of work. Whenever I ask them for product recommendations â€” whether itâ€™s the best retinol serum or the right sunscreen to wear on a plane â€” one brand invariably gets lots of love: La Roche-Posay.

The French skincare brand, which recently turned 50 years old, will likely already sound familiar if youâ€™re a fan of drugstore beauty. Its hero products have gone viral many times over, in particular the Cicaplast Balm B5, which has racked up millions of views on TikTok for its myriad uses, mainly to aid skin repair and hydration.

But all this immense social media hype isnâ€™t merely skin deep. La Roche-Posay is a leading brand in research on the microbiome, aka the trillions of microorganisms (think friendly bacteria, fungi, and so much more) that make up the largest organ of the body â€” the skin. Whatâ€™s more, most of its product range contains thermal spring water sourced from La Roche-Posay, an actual place in France, which is rich in minerals that have calming and soothing benefits for the skin.

Donâ€™t just take our word for it. Ahead, weâ€™ve asked leading dermatologists to share their favorite La Roche-Posay products and what theyâ€™d recommend to patients with various skin concerns.

DashDividers_1_500x100

La Roche-Posay Cicaplast Balm B5 Multi-Purpose Cream, $19.99

â€œI love this stuff and have multiple tubes of it all over my house. It contains soothing shea butter, madecassoside [an ingredient derived from centella asiatica, also known as cica, an herb with soothing, anti-inflammatory, and healing properties]. Thereâ€™s also panthenol (vitamin B5), which has moisturizing and hydration-boosting benefits. This is an extremely versatile product; you can use it on chafed and irritated skin or apply it over your retinoids if you want a calming moisturizer. It even works well on chapped lips (you need to put in a bit of elbow grease since it has a thicker consistency). It can be used as a soothing balm for diaper rashes on children, too.â€ â€” Dr. Daniel Sugai, MD, board-certified dermatologist

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

La Roche-Posay Thermal Spring Water, $15.99

â€œThis mist is a great product to keep in the bathroom. It moistens the skin before you apply lotion, which helps lock in hydration. The water comes from the thermal springs in La Roche-Posay, France, and is rich in minerals like selenium and calcium, which calm the skin. In the summer, I like to keep this in the fridge and use it as a cooling mist when Iâ€™m about to step out of the house (make sure youâ€™re wearing water-resistant sunscreen, though). You can also put it in a cooler bag and keep it in your car to spray on your body when youâ€™re overheated.â€ â€” Dr. Adeline Kikam, MD, board-certified dermatologist

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

La Roche-Posay Lipikar AP+M Triple Repair Body Moisturizing Cream, $22.99

â€œFor my patients with atopic dermatitis, eczema, and dry skin, I always recommend the Lipikar AP+M Cream. Itâ€™s much more than just a moisturizer: La Roche-Posay has published a series of clinical studies showing how its star ingredient, the thermal spring water, positively impacts the skinâ€™s microbiome. Itâ€™s proven to have prebiotic properties [which means it enhances the growth of good bacteria that benefit your skin] and reduces inflammation. I have dry skin, so I use this moisturizer on my face and all over my body; itâ€™s great at locking in moisture [thanks to ingredients like barrier-strengthening ceramides and shea butter, which soothe and hydrate the skin].â€ â€” Dr. Heather Woolery-Lloyd, MD, board-certified dermatologist

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

La Roche-Posay Mela B3 Dark Spot Corrector Serum, $44.99

â€œI often recommend this serum to women of color, who are predisposed to hyperpigmentation. It features Melasyl, a proprietary ingredient that actively targets discoloration. Itâ€™s all about prevention: Melasyl blocks the precursors to melanin, effectively stopping the formation of increased pigment in the skin, so you donâ€™t even get the discoloration. For patients prone to hyperpigmentation when getting a chemical peel or microdermal abrasion, I put them on this serum for two to four weeks prior [as hyperpigmentation can be a side effect after the procedure]. The serum also contains 10% niacinamide (or vitamin B3), which helps with hyperpigmentation and uneven skin tone. I recommend using this serum alongside the Mela B3 Dark Spot Face Cleanser, and Mela B3 UV Daily Moisturizer Sunscreen, SPF 30.â€ â€” Dr. Valerie D. Callender, MD, board-certified dermatologist

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

La Roche-Posay Hyalu B5 Pure Hyaluronic Acid Face Serum, $39.99

â€œThe Hyalu B5 is great for hydration; I like to apply this twice a day with the Mela B3 Serum. It has a very lightweight texture that makes it easy to layer, and the hyaluronic acid hydrates the skin without clogging the pores [while vitamin B5 further boosts the moisturizing benefits]. Since the Mela B3 Serum has a mild retinol that gently exfoliates the skin, you definitely want something hydrating, too. My recommended routine would be a cleanser, followed by Mela B3, then the Hyalu B5.â€ â€” Dr. Valerie Callender, MD, board-certified dermatologist (@callenderskin)

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

La Roche-Posay Lipikar AP+ Gentle Foaming Cleansing Oil, $21.99

â€œI live in Colorado, and many of my patients struggle with dry skin. Theyâ€™d moisturize with lotions and tell me that their skin still feels really dry. In a lot of cases, they are actually using the wrong body wash. The easiest thing Iâ€™d recommend is switching to this shower oil, since it moisturizes while cleansing the skin. The formula is oil-based, so it gives you that extra moisture boost before you even exit the shower and put on body cream. This is a foaming oil, so it lathers up and is great at taking off makeup, dirt, and removing impurities.â€ â€” Dr. Scott Walter, MD, board-certified dermatologist

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

La Roche-Posay Anthelios UV Hydra Sunscreen SPF 50, $39.99

â€œI always say that the best sunscreen is the one that you want to put on every day. I love this SPF moisturizer for that exact reason; the cosmetically elegant formula feels so nice that you actually donâ€™t mind putting it on. Itâ€™s ultra lightweight, absorbs in seconds, and provides SPF 50 broad-spectrum protection, while hyaluronic acid leaves the skin looking dewy. The pump dispenser is so convenient, too. I have dry skin, and this one is my go-to.â€ â€” Dr. Woolery-Lloyd

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

La Roche-Posay Toleriane Double Repair Face Moisturizer, $25.99

â€œThe Toleriane range is my favorite. It has proven to have microbiome-repairing properties and wonâ€™t irritate even the most sensitive skin. I treat a lot of patients with acne-prone skin who donâ€™t want anything too sticky. The Toleriane Double Repair Face Moisturizer has just the right consistency and hydrates the skin without clogging pores. It has niacinamide and glycerin, which soothe and help the skin retain moisture.â€ â€” Dr. Hilary Baldwin, MD, board-certified dermatologist

Shop Ulta

title: Stay Warm With These 2026 Winter Coat Trends â€” From Funnel Necks to Scarf Coats
text:
Stay Warm With These 2026 Winter Coat Trends â€” From Funnel Necks to Scarf Coats

Winter jackets are practical, but the best ones arenâ€™t a supporting act â€” theyâ€™re the main character, serving as the outfit. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re all about layering up in outerwear that delivers warmth and wow factor. Whether youâ€™re leaning into the coziness of a faux-fur coat or the versatility of a trench coat, the right winter topper can transform even the simplest look into a moment.Â 

This season, the top winter trends point towards bold plaids (or even more dramatic checks), animal print (yes, leopard print is always in fashion), and winter whites (to channel Pantoneâ€™s Color of the Year: Cloud Dancer). And for silhouettes, itâ€™s time to pull out your scarf jackets from a couple of seasons back (or invest in a new one) and bundle up in funnel-neck designs (that donâ€™t require a chunky scarf).Â 

Whether youâ€™re looking for an elevated coat to wear over winter wedding guest dresses or a cozy cropped jacket to pair with lounge sets, you can brave the cold in style.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Plaid Coats

The winter calls for festive plaids, especially on your outerwear. This season, the closet mainstay is refreshed with punchier colors and unexpected silhouettes. Think: vibrant color combos, blazers, and bomber jackets. Weâ€™re especially eyeing reversible jacket designs that can transform with different outfits and seasons.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Scarf Coats

It seems like every It-girl on our feeds and on the streets is wearing a scarf coat. The bundled-up silhouette trended a couple of years back â€” briefly overtaken by the cape jacket â€” and is back at the forefront. Wear the scarves loosely hanging down or wrapped snugly around your neck (and be sure to also look out for coats with detachable scarves).Â 

DashDividers_1_500x100

Winter White Coats

A winter essential thatâ€™s equal parts cozy and cool, a white coat should be in your closet (or in your shopping cart), especially thanks to Pantoneâ€™s Cloud Dancer color and the trending aprÃ¨s-ski aesthetic. The best part is that you can go down any route, from sporty puffer jackets and wool cropped coats to faux fur zip-ups and wrap trenches.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Funnel Neck Coats

Funnel neck coats are one of those runway trends that are actually wearable IRL. The exaggerated high necks arenâ€™t just dramatic, theyâ€™re also practical for keeping the wind and snow from ruining your winter makeup looks. You can find the trendy silhouette across leather jackets, wool dress coats, and even longline vests.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Animal Print Coats

Nothing says winter glamour like a faux-fur coat. And an animal print faux-fur coat is an even more bold and playful option. While you canâ€™t go wrong with classic leopards and cheetahs, more unexpected animal prints â€” like cow, zebra, deer, giraffe, and even snow leopard â€” are trending. There are also non-furry fabrics that can be worn cross-seasonally.

title: Mars In Aquarius Is Here â€” Itâ€™s Time To Express Yourself
text:
Mars In Aquarius Is Here â€” Itâ€™s Time To Express Yourself

You say you wantÂ change?Â Well,Â the time has come! Action planet Mars is entering the sign of Aquarius, encouraging us to push back popular notions and lean into our one-of-a-kind perspectives. The opportunity to express ourselves is here. As a result,Â weâ€™llÂ be able to direct our attention toward the future and take steps to set the intention that will help usÂ attainÂ our dream. First, we must get out of our comfort zones and take a leap of faith. Every visionary has begun their journey here.Â Letâ€™sÂ get it started! The path less taken is ready for us to walk down.Â 

Itâ€™sÂ been over a year since Mars was in theÂ Air sign of Aquarius. Now thatÂ itâ€™sÂ coming back into orbit, from January 23rdÂ to March 2nd, we are reaffirming our commitment to causes and striving to give our best to care for others in our community. Mars in AquariusÂ isnâ€™tÂ shy about giving us the stamina to assert ourselves. Still, this transit does require a more innovative approach to taking a stance and defining our needs and desires. This often marks a time of uprising andÂ rebellion, whenÂ we speak our minds and take a stand to assert our personal beliefs. Note that this can transcend in any form â€” from something as simple as defying the â€œnormsâ€ of relationships to fashion trends to peer groups.Â Weâ€™reÂ elevating our lives toÂ showcaseÂ our unique sentiments, feelings, and talents.Â 

While it is fantastic to captivate an audience and to hold personal power, theÂ caveatÂ is that once we get on our soapboxes,Â itâ€™llÂ be hard to listen to different perspectives and not force our ideals onto others. Knowing when to slow down and take a step back can be challenging, butÂ itâ€™sÂ essential. To effect change in the world, we must have an open mind and accept that everyone holds different views â€” even if we disagree with them. However, having an active discourse and debate isÂ a great wayÂ to harness the diverse ways people think. A moderator, or mutual acquaintance, should be present to ensure we do not take the conversation too far â€” especially on January 19th, when Mars and Pluto form a conjunction in Aquarius (this is an astrological aspect that occurs when two planets come together in the same sign and degree) triangulating circumstances.Â Â Â 

Being a social justice warrior will be at the forefront of our hearts and passions. Still,Â itâ€™sÂ also vital to examine situations that requireÂ assistanceÂ on both a smaller scale and a collective level. Focusing on social dynamics, injustices, and local issues in ourÂ neighborhoodsÂ or cities will be necessary. Try to be more involved in politics, voter registration, or evenÂ participateÂ in charitableÂ endeavors. Paying it forward will be rewarding on many levels, particularly when it comes to our aspirations to better the common good â€” a vibe we will feel during the Snow Full Moon in Leo on February 1st.Â 

When it comes to friendships and relationships, we often find ourselves drawn to those who align with our aspirations. Looking at the people who add fun, excitement, and push us toÂ think outside the boxÂ propels us to regenerate our lives and be different. Their presence reassures and inspires us to be our best, most authentic selves. We can live freely and authentically, thanks to Mars in Aquarius. February 27thÂ motivates us to take the leap towards confidence and embracing ourselves, due to Uranus in Taurus squaring off with Mars.Â Weâ€™llÂ want to make a break into the purest essences that define us.Â 

Mars in Aquarius is going to be a moment in which we strive to be greater. WeÂ arenâ€™tÂ going to sit back and let life happen. Be bold and daring! By taking a firm stand, we can do our best to implement transformation and evolution â€” not only in the world but also in our personal lives. The goal is to improve in any way we can, so what are you waiting for?
